p: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first report on the diversity and antimicrobial activity of endophytic fungi isolated from C. japonicus. Thus, the fungi with antimicrobial activity obtained in this study still have the potential to produce new structures natural products. In addition, F8158 exhibited higher antagonistic activity against V. mali var. mali, B. cinerea Pers.: Fr., and S. sclerotiorum (Lib.) de Bary compared with previous studies and have a potential application in biological control [ 31, 32, 33].
